meanings.sent1: The new toy looked fremd to the child.
meanings.sent2: The dark forest felt fremd to the hiker.
meanings.sent3: The fremd noise turned out to be just a squirrel playing.
meanings.sent4: The fremd landscape seemed like a scene from a dream.
meanings.sent5: The fremd smell of the exotic spices lingered in the air.

meanings.sent1: The fremd language was difficult to understand.
meanings.sent2: The traveler felt fremd in the bustling city.
meanings.sent3: The fremd customs fascinated the curious child.
meanings.sent4: The fremd spacecraft landed on the unknown planet.
meanings.sent5: The fremd attire of the visitors caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Not belonging to one's own country or group
meanings.sent1: The fremd flag represented a distant nation.
meanings.sent2: The fremd accent hinted at her foreign origin.
meanings.sent3: The fremd cuisine introduced new flavors to the locals.
meanings.sent4: The fremd traditions added diversity to the community.
meanings.sent5: The fremd music transported them to faraway lands.
